subject: Law
title: Economic Espionage Act
description: A fast breakdown of Economic Espionage Act for builders.

hook.text: An engineer at a US company stole chip designs for a Chinese competitor. It wasn't just theftâ€”it was a federal crime.

buildup.text: The Economic Espionage Act (1996) makes theft of trade secrets a federal crime, with harsh penalties.

discovery.text: It covers two offenses: economic espionage (for a foreign government) and commercial trade secret theft.

twist.text: Penalties reach $5 million in fines and 15 years in prison for espionage benefiting a foreign state.

climax.text: The Defend Trade Secrets Act (2016) added a federal civil cause of action, letting companies sue directly.

punchline.text: Stealing ideas isn't just unethical. It's criminal.

quiz.question: What does the Economic Espionage Act criminalize?
